title: Construction Demand Lifts Caterpillar Profit as Order Backlog Grows
sub_head: Ongoing supply-chain challenges lead machinery company to fall behind on more orders
body:
Strong construction activity in the U.S. drove demand for equipment maker Caterpillar Inc., though the company said it faced higher costs and its order backlog increased by billions.
Caterpillar said Friday that it continues to face issues obtaining enough electronics, semiconductors and other parts to make hydraulic shovels and asphalt pavers. The companyâ€™s backlog increased by $8.9 billion, or around 64%, in the quarter ended Dec. 31 from the year before.
